content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the endpoint is changed to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point.)

The shortest path from node 4 to node 3 is:

1->2->3

This path uses two edges to reach the target node: [0, 5] for the edge from node 4 to node 5 and [2, 3] for the edge from node 5 to node 3. Note that this shortest path does not include the previous node 4 because you said that changing the endpoint to the previous point should return the original shortest path minus the last point.

The shortest path from node 4 to node 2 is:

1->2

This path uses one edge to reach the target node: [2, 4]. Note that this shortest path does not include the previous node 4 because you said that changing the endpoint to the previous point should return the original shortest path minus the last point.
